intro: Curculigo trichocarpa, commonly known as the hairy curculigo, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving it its common name. Curculigo trichocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
